I love your pretty smile and your big blue eyes and I am really excited to start a family with you. I think you'll make an amazing mom and I'm just really excited for our future," he said.
Meghann told her husband he makes her "a better person" and expressed her devotion to him.
"I am so excited to raise a child with you, so I am choosing to stay married to you because I can't imagine being away from you and I love you," she said.

Are they still together? No. After agreeing to stay together in the season finale, the couple experienced a miscarriage. Despite Meghann's suggestion that they go to couples' therapy, they still struggled to communicate. One day, they had a fight and Derrek broke up with his wife over the phone then moved out.
"There's never a good time to do it. It's always going to be hard. I knew that this wasn't the right person for me. I had to be true to myself and be true to Meghann," Derrek said.

Meghann offered her take on the breakup, saying, "When he broke up with me, something in my head changed and I couldn't remember anything good from our relationship. I just remembered all the bad. And then I watched (the show) and then I remembered all the good and that was hard."
Meghann said she doesn't see Derrek as a "bad person," but said he didn't handle their breakup well.
"I wasn't happy. I don't think Meghann was happy," he said.
Rhonda and Pat

How it started: It didn't take long for chemistry to spark between Rhonda and Pat on their wedding day. The couple had plenty of fun at their reception and even jumped in the pool together. It was soon apparent that their fun-loving personalities were a good match.

How it went: Once they started diving deeper in their relationship, Rhonda and Pat hit a few roadblocks. Rhonda told her husband she didn't feel like he was interested in hearing about her life since he regularly made the conversation about him. He was taken aback and tried to remedy the situation.
Still, it was a consistent theme throughout the eight-week experiment for the newlyweds.
How it ended in the season finale: While preparing to make his decision Pat admitted that he was feeling "conflicted."
"Despite the disconnects and the challenges that Rhonda and I have had, we did make a deep connection. And I feel in my heart that I have established deep love for Rhonda," he said.
While reflecting on the decision awaiting her, Rhonda said she wanted Pat to know that she "really sincerely appreciated him and his commitment to this marriage."
"It's been hard but also it's been everything I think I could have ever hoped for," she said.

When it came time to share their decisions, Rhonda said she suspected that Pat didn't want to stay married based on his closed off body language. He then explained that he ignored red flags in his first marriage and didn't want to do that this time around.
"I do not trust that I will be seen and heard as my authentic self," he said.
Rhonda wasn't sure what he meant, so Pat explained that he had struggled hearing her repeatedly allege he didn't care about her.
The relationship experts on hand encouraged the couple to talk through their issues. Rhonda apologized to Pat but said her emotional needs hadn't been met.

"I just think I've been really, really frustrated with you and my frustration pushes you away. And that's not my intention. I'm struggling on how to deal with it. So I would (like to) apologize for making you feel like I'm pushing you away," she said.
Pat thanked his wife and said he went into the discussion not wanting to move forward, but was now thinking he may be "being too rigid."

Ultimately, Pat decided he wanted to continue to work on their marriage. Rhonda said she didn't feel "as open or hopeful" as she did going into the discussion, but wasn't ready to give up on their relationship.

Are they still together? No. During the reunion, Rhonda said she and Pat stayed together for nine months after decision day. At that point, Pat went to Europe for a month on his own. He did invite her to go, but she'd already taken a lot of time off from work and decided to stay home.

When Pat returned home, Rhonda said she was "on cloud nine" for a period of 10 days. One day, she saw him listening to a meditation about anger and asked if he was angry that they hadn't slept together since he got home. He was, and at dinner that night he told Rhonda he was done with their relationship.
During the reunion, Pat said he'd felt that way "for quite some time." Rhonda then explained that he was "very insecure" and said "that insecurity was a complete turnoff romantically."

Rhonda suggested that Pat only wanted a wife, and not necessarily her, adding that he wanted physical intimacy that would turn into a romantic connection. However, she wanted a connection and said intimacy would be the icing on the cake.
Belynda and Chad

How it started: When Belynda and Chad got married, it was a slow burn at first. However, they both seemed committed to exploring their connection and shared some sweet moments as they got to know each other.

How it went: Chad repeatedly expressed frustration with Belynda's dog sleeping in their bed throughout the experiment. He also grew tired of the filming schedule and said "I don't give a f--- about this show" during one heated moment. Still, the couple's connection grew over time.
Before decision day, Belynda said she was doubtful that she'd want to stay married based on Chad's recent aggressive behavior.
How it ended in the season finale: Belynda described her husband as "kind, funny and sweet" on decision day but admitted that her marriage had been "a little exhausting at times."
“I just don’t want to lose my voice. I can’t lose myself in a marriage and I feel like I need to remember that I’m also there and that I also matter,” she said.
In a confessional interview, Chad said he wanted to be with his wife and couldn't "imagine my life without Belynda."
He also acknowledged that he had "hurt" his wife at times with his impatience and said he needed "to find healthier ways to burn off some steam."

When the moment to make a decision arrived, Chad went first, saying, "I genuinely care about you and I believe you care about me. And I don't think there's anything we can't figure out as long as (we keep that in mind)."
Chad said he was willing to do "whatever it takes" to make their marriage work and asked if Belynda was willing to stay together.

"I mean, I think if anything, if I had a reason to walk away it would just be because we weren't working on it the way we committed and said we were going to. But I know that if we're working on it, we can get through it, so yes, I will stay married to you," she replied.
Are they still together? No. During the reunion special, Belynda and Chad announced that they were no longer married.

They both recalled an incident with his cat and her dog after they returned home from decision day, saying Chad was triggered by the animals' behavior and his anxiety came out as he began to yell at Belynda, saying her dog wasn't trained.
Belynda said the incident reminded her of a prior marriage when her ex-husband would yell. She decided to grab her things and left with the dog.
While reflecting on their relationship, Belynda also said Chad's drinking issues were an obstacle for her to overcome.
Brittany and Will
How it started: Brittany and Will had a sweet connection after  they met for the first time at the altar. However, things were understandably a bit awkward at first.

How it went: While getting to know each other, Brittany and Will struggled with communication issues. Brittany wanted her husband to open up and be more expressive with his emotions, but he was slow to show his vulnerable side.

How it ended in the season finale: On decision day, Brittany was "hopeful" when she woke up. Then Will called her to say his answer was no. Still, they both showed up to the discussion to talk things out.
Will arrived first and told the relationship experts he intended to leave his marriage.
"I think that throughout this, her not thinking I'm trying, her not thinking that I'm doing anything, her not feeling anything from what I'm doing, that was the theme," he said.
Will went on to say that his wife “tries to compare things to how she feels them” and said “if it’s not how she feels, then it doesn't matter and it's not validated.”
When Brittany arrived, she apologized to her husband for not being able to "express how important" he was to her. She then called him "the most kind, genuine, thoughtful person."
"I'm just so sorry if I haven't made you feel that way, if I haven't made you feel like you're important to me and your feelings are important to me, because they are," she said.
"I'm thankful that I was able to make you feel those things in those ways. I didn't know," Will replied.
Will said he needed more time and walked away to gather his thoughts. When he returned, Will decided to give their marriage another try.
"Yes, I do want to be with you and I do want to continue this and I want to learn with you," he said.

Are they still together? No. During the reunion, Brittany revealed that she and Will hadn't spoken together since the show ended. She recalled how he went away for work for a week after the finale then ended things when he returned.

Will shared his side of the story, saying he did "adore" Brittany and decided to stay with her in the heat of the moment since he didn't want to see her sad. However, she said she "had an inkling" that they would break up when he returned home.

title: Miss Jamaica Gabrielle Henry Recovering After Falling Off Stage During Pageant
summary: Miss Jamaica Gabrielle Henry fell off stage during Miss Universe preliminary rounds in Bangkok and was taken to hospital. She's now recovering from the fall.
story: A Miss Universe contestant is recovering after suffering a major fall during the pageant.
In a shocking moment during the preliminary evening gown round on Nov. 19, Miss Jamaica Gabrielle Henry took a massive fall off the stage.

In video shared by Meekii Modez on Instagram, Henry is seen walking across the stage in a stunning orange gown with high heels. After posing at the front, she continues to walk towards the left of the stage when she takes the tumble.
People are seen standing up in shock to make sure she is OK.
Additional video online shows a group of people coming to her aid and removing her on a stretcher.

Hours later, the Miss Universe Jamaica Organization released a statement offering an update on Henry. The organization confirmed that she “experienced a fall from the main stage during the evening gown round” ahead of the Miss Universe finals this weekend in Thailand.

“She was rushed to the Paolo Rangsit Hospital, where medical professionals are attending to her care and have advised that she is not suffering from any life-threatening injuries,” the statement posted on Instagram reads. “However, they continue to conduct tests to ensure her full recovery.”

The organization asked for people to “stay upbeat, lift her in prayer, and send positive thoughts as she receives the necessary medical care.” It also thanked people for the outpouring of love and support.
Prior to the accident, Henry had participated in the national costume and swimsuit portion of the pageant.
Miss Universe Organization President Raúl Rocha also shared an update on his Instagram, writing that he left the hospital where Henry is being treated.
“I was there with her family and her, and thankfully, there are no broken bones and she is under good care,” he wrote in part.
The 74th Miss Universe competition kicked off with the sashing ceremony on Nov. 5.

The pageant got off to a rocky start after Miss Mexico Fatima Bosch spoke out following an argument with pageant executive Nawat Itsaragrisil, who criticized and singled her out at an official event. The Thai businessman and national director of Miss Universe Thailand would go on to apologize to Bosch after Rocha also condemned his behavior.

title: 2025 CMA Awards Winners: Lainey Wilson, Zach Top, Ella Langley and More
summary: So many great artists took home awards at the 2025 Country Music Awards. See the full list of winners, including Lainey Wilson, Zach Top and more.
story: What a night to behold!

Grammy winner Lainey Wilson walked away with several trophies at the 2025 Country Music Awards. Some other artists who won big at this year's event are Zach Top, who took home his first CMA for new artist of the year, and Brooks & Dunn, who now hold the record for the most CMAs of all time.
Wilson, who hosted the show, performed a mashup of hit country songs like Shaboozey's “A Bar Song (Tipsy),” Chris Stapleton's “White Horse” and Little Big Town's “Girl Crush.”
Some other artists who took the stage that night are Kelsea Ballerini, Luke Combs and Riley Green.

Vince Gill also had a standout moment that evening as he was the recipient of the Willie Nelson Lifetime Achievement Award. In his speech, he talked about Nelson's impact on the world and the legacy of his music.

"He's a great role model," Gill said. "He's a great person to mentor to us to still look ahead. I'm 60 years old. I'm right on his heels, but what he's accomplished and what he's given us is pretty staggering."

"I feel a great validation for when I left home 50 years ago, made my first record 51 years ago, came here in Nashville in 1975 to make a record. All my hopes and dreams were involved in it and I kept doing it and I kept doing it and would've kept doing it no matter what, success or no success that's how deeply I loved my music," he added.

title: Colleen Hoover Speaks Out About ‘It Ends With Us’ Stars’ Legal Woes: ‘I Just Find It All Around Sad’
summary: Colleen Hoover says the legal saga involving “It Ends With Us” stars Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni has been tough for her to process
story: Colleen Hoover says the legal saga involving “It Ends With Us” stars Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni has been tough for her to process.

Hoover is the author of the 2016 book that was the basis for the 2024 film of the same name. The movie has been tainted with controversy since late last year, when Lively filed a lawsuit against Baldoni, in which she accuses him of sexual harassment on the set, as well as creating a smear campaign against her. Baldoni’s $400 million countersuit against Lively and a defamation suit he filed against The New York Times was dismissed in June.
The legal issues have cast a shadow over the movie, while Hoover told Elle magazine in a Nov. 20 article that the matter is “unfortunate” and “disappointing.”

“It feels like a circus,” she said. “When there are real people involved, with real feelings and emotions. This actually truly has impacted some of the actors’ careers in huge ways. And I just find it all around sad.”
Hoover, who, according to Elle, was prepping to give a deposition at the time she spoke with the magazine, wants to avoid becoming part of the story herself.

“I’m just trying to stay removed from the negativity. I have my own story I could tell … but I don’t want to bring attention to it, and I don’t want to have to put someone else down to lift myself up. So I’d rather just ignore it and let people think and say what they’re going to say,” she said.
“I feel like it’s so big at this point that there’s nothing anyone can say to change whatever opinion people have of it, even though no one has the actual truth. Not even me.”

A New York judge on Oct. 31 formally ended Baldoni’s countersuit against Lively and the Times when Baldoni and his legal team missed a deadline to file an amended complaint. Attorneys for Lively and Baldoni did not respond to a request for comment from NBC News at the time.
Lively’s lawsuit against Baldoni goes to trial in March 2026.

“It Ends With Us” centers on florist Lily Bloom (Lively), whose relationship with neurosurgeon Ryle Kincaid (Baldoni, who also directed the film) unfurls into domestic violence, following a pattern of abuse Lily witnessed by her father toward her mother.
The basis of “It Ends With Us” was drawn from Hoover’s mother’s own experience. The author says the controversy takes away from what she has had to endure.

“The book was inspired by her story, and now it gives us PTSD to think about it,” she said. “I feel awful because I almost feel like she’s gone through more with the aftermath of this film, more pain than she went through with my dad, just seeing the ugliness of it.”
The legal matter between Lively and Baldoni has also changed how Hoover feels about the book.

“I can’t even recommend it anymore. I feel like (the lawsuit) has overshadowed it,” she says. “I’m almost embarrassed to say I wrote it. When people ask what I do, I’m just like, ‘I’m a writer. Please don’t ask me what I wrote.’”

“The more time that passes, the easier everything gets for all of us,” she continued. “But it is sad, because I was very proud of that book. And I’m still proud of it, but less publicly so. Maybe I need therapy, I don’t know.”

title: Cynthia Erivo Reacts to Protecting Ariana Grande After Red Carpet Ambush: ‘Wanted to Make Sure She Was OK’
summary: Cynthia Erivo exclusively shared on TODAY what happened when "Wicked" co-star Ariana Grande was rushed by a fan on a red carpet in Singapore.
story: Cynthia Erivo shared for the first time what was going through her mind when she shielded “Wicked: For Good” co-star Ariana Grande from an overzealous fan who rushed at her during the film’s premiere in Singapore.

Erivo spoke in an exclusive interview with Savannah Guthrie on TODAY on Nov. 20 about the potentially frightening moment when a man named Johnson Wen rushed at Grande at the event. Erivo pried Wen off Grande while costar Michelle Yeoh put her arms around Grande to pull her away from Wen.

“I wasn’t really thinking,” Erivo said. “I just wanted to make sure my friend was safe. I’m sure he didn’t mean us harm, but you never know with those things, and I wanted to make sure that she was OK. That was my first instinct.”
Erivo and Grande have become close during the filming of the two “Wicked” films and often have been inseparable during their press tours to promote the hit movies.

“This is a long-lasting friendship for us,” Erivo told Savannah. “We’re kind of like sisters at this moment. And I think we’ve both learned from each other and given each other some really, really beautiful gifts. We’ve really looked after each other through this.”

Video of the incident appears to show that Grande was not aware of the situation and looked scared as the man ran toward her and put his arm around her. Security then rushed in and took the man to the ground after Erivo worked to separate him from Grande.

The man was identified as Wen, a social media influencer who has in the past stormed stage shows by performers like Katy Perry and The Weeknd. He described himself in a message to NBC News as a “mega fan” of Grande and said he was “happy” to meet her.
Wen was sentenced on Nov. 17 to nine days in jail after pleading guilty to a charge of being a public nuisance.
Grande’s fans pointed out that she has been traumatized at previous events like the 2017 bombing of her concert in Manchester in which 22 people were killed.

“After all the trauma Ari has been through, this is beyond disrespectful,” one person commented on a video of the moment posted on Instagram by Wen. “Not just to her, but to the cast and to all the fans. It’s literally infuriating. You should be ashamed.”

title: McDonald’s New Grinch Meal Revives Menu Item From the ‘90s
summary: McDonald's is launching a new adult Happy Meal with the Grinch for the holiday season, and it includes Dill Pickle “Grinch Salt” McShaker Fries.
story: We know the Grinch has dinner with himself at 6:30 (he “can’t cancel that again!”), but now we know what he’ll be having.
McDonald’s is putting a mischievous spin on the holiday season by introducing its new Grinch Meal featuring Dr. Seuss’s holiday-hating character.

A collaboration between the fast food chain and Dr. Seuss Enterprises, the meal allows Mount Crumpit’s resident grump to introduce his Dill Pickle “Grinch Salt” McShaker Fries, the company announced in a press release.
The special fries, available for the first time in the U.S., bring back the McShaker bag, a long-lost McDonald’s menu item.
Customers use the McShaker bag to sprinkle dill pickle seasoning all over their fries. The fries are paired with a choice of a Big Mac or 10-piece Chicken McNuggets and a medium drink.

The normally not-nice Grinch is also sneaking a surprise gift into every meal: a pair of “spirited socks” that feature a hand-scribbled message from the Grinch telling everyone how he feels about holiday season.
The socks come in “four unhinged colors” and can be used as an makeshift Christmas stocking, as the Grinch himself can attest.

“THiS iS MY MEAL AND i DiDN’T PARTNER WiTH McDONALD’S OUT OF THE GOODNESS OF MY HEART,” the Grinch said in McDonald’s release. “i SAW AN OPPORTUNiTY TO BRiNG MiSCHiEF TO YOUR BELOVED ‘RESTAURANT’ WiTH MY DELiCiOUS CHAOS FOR THE HOLiDAYS AND i TOOK iT. SO GO AHEAD, GRAB MY MEAL STARTING DEC. 2 — YOU’RE WELCOME FOR MAKiNG YOUR HOLiDAYS iNFiNiTELY MORE iNTERESTiNG.”
McDonald’s previously offered a McShaker bag and a choice of seasonings with Shake Shake Fries, which were taken off U.S. menus sometime in the ‘90s.

“McShaker Fries have been a favorite on international menus for years, such as Sour Cream & Black Pepper McShaker Fries in Poland or Masala McShaker Fries in Canada,” a McDonald’s representative tells TODAY.com. “This is the first time in recent years that they will be available nationally in the U.S. market. “
The Grinch Meal will be available for a limited time beginning Tuesday, Dec. 2 at participating restaurants, while supplies last.

The new meal is in line with the trendy zeal for all things pickled-flavored in the fast-food world, including Popeye’s pickle glaze sandwich and fried pickles, available for a limited time earlier this year, and Jimmy John’s new Picklewich, which was introduced in 2024 and uses a dill pickle in place of bread.

title: 'Man on the Inside' Cast and Creators Tease Season 2's Romance, Family Secrets and More
summary: Ted Danson and Mary Steenburgen talk about playing on-screen love interests and the creator Mike Schur teases more Season 2 twists.
story: How do you solve the case of a college president being blackmailed if every member of the faculty is a suspect? You need a man on the inside. It also helps if that man is a former professor-turned private investigator.

Created by Mike Shur and based the 2020 Chilean documentary “The Mole Agent,” the Netflix comedic mystery "Man on the Inside" follows Charles Nieuwendyk (Ted Danson), an engineering professor who turns to solving mysteries.

In Season 2, out Nov. 20, he investigates a cryptic blackmailer who is threatening Jack Berenger (Max Greenfield), the president of Wheeler College, and the proposed $400 million donation made by billionaire alumni Brad Vinick (Gary Cole).
To complicate matters even further, the detective starts falling for one of his suspects, a vibrant music teacher named Mona (Mary Steenburgen).

After Charles solved the case of a missing ruby necklace at Pacific View Retirement Community in Season 1, he finds himself in an investigative rut. Catching a man having an affair might be interesting the first time around, but after the ninth, Charles is ready to never encounter a cheating man again. That’s why, when he hears about Berenger’s case, he jumps at the chance to go undercover.

As soon as Charles steps foot on the campus of Wheeler College, he assembles a long list of possible suspects, all of whom have a reason to detest the billionaire graduate who is known for flying his dog on a private jet every day from San Francisco to Aspen.

While Charles is busy gathering evidence, his boss Julie (Lilah Richcreek Estrada) must seek help from a precarious source — who just also happens to be her estranged mother, Vanessa (Constance Marie).
One theme that Shur wanted to examine in “A Man on the Inside” was the need for connection and how the dynamic relationship between adult children and their aging parents evolve over time.
In Season 1, Charles grew distant from his daughter Emily (Mary Elizabeth Ellis) following the death of his wife.

“They loved each other and were close, but drifted apart because of a tragedy that happened,” Shur tells TODAY.com. Over the course of the first season, Charles learned how to communicate his shared grief with Emily.

That same theme of familial reconciliation can be seen with Julie and her mother. Because Julie never discussed her personal life with Charles, Shur described how this new season was a chance for viewers to get to know Julie and her past.

“There’s a reason this woman is a private investigator,” Shur says. “There’s a reason that she’s so guarded and mistrustful of people — almost borderline paranoid. We thought, ‘What if the story is her mom was a con artist and was arrested when she was a kid?’ That explains a lot about that character. But then what if that woman is still in her life in a very tangential way? It was a wonderful story to tell about making amends with a parent.”

While Season 1 explored Charles’ loneliness and heartache after his late wife’s death, Season 2 adds a romantic twist for Charles. Who better to play a love interest opposite Danson than Steenburgen, his actual wife of 30 years?
Speaking with TODAY.com, Danson shared how his character changed because of his newfound relationship with Mona.

“The fact that you are willing to take a chance at something so vulnerable as opening your heart back up to another person takes courage,” Danson says. “A lot of times, people would rather not risk loss again. They play safe and rock back on their heels. It was exciting for me to play something that I believe is worth putting out in the world, which is to stay curious and go for it because life’s not over.”

Steenburgen and Danson have been married for 30 years, but their characters only came together in their 70s. In one scene, Mona talks about how, at their age, both she and Charles have experienced terrific highs and terrible lows, but she’s learned to not get stuck in the past or worry about the future. Instead, her goal is to capture the joy of the present.
"Now is a time where I’ve gotten to grow as a person.”
Mary steenburgen
Steenburgen tells TODAY.com how age has helped her find those moments of bliss her character described.

“Part of it is that so much of my younger life was about other people,” Steenburgen says. “I was nurturing children. I was taking care of my parents. But now is a time where I’ve gotten to grow as a person.”
Referencing Dylan Thomas’ poem, “Do not go gentle into that good night,” Steenburgen adds that age isn’t a time to “slow down but live faster and harder."
And if you can do it with someone you adore, like she’s fortunate enough to, how can you not feel that joy?

title: Kourtney Kardashian Reacts to Kim's Brain Aneurysm Diagnosis: 'I'm Definitely Worried'
summary: On "The Kardashians," Kourtney Kardashian Barker tells her sister Kim Kardashian that she needs to slow down after she learns about her brain aneurysm diagnosis.
story: Kim Kardashian is opening up about her health.
On Season 7, Episode 5, of “The Kardashians,” Kardashian revealed that doctors found an aneurysm in her brain, which alarmed her sister Kourtney Kardashian Barker.

“I did a prenuvo scan and they called me today and they’re like, ‘Everything looks great, but you have an aneurysm in your brain,’ and they’re like, ‘It’s been there for years.’ It was here two years ago,’” she said.

According to Mayo Clinic, an aneurysm is “a bulge or ballooning in the wall of a blood vessel” and can form in several parts of the body. A ruptured aneurysm can cause bleeding inside the body, which can result in death, according to the Mayo Clinic.

While talking to her sister, Kardashian said that doctors told her that an aneurysm can be ruptured by stress. The Skims founder explained that she’s been under a lot of it lately studying for the bar exam and has developed hives because of it.
“I’m definitely worried about Kim. She has so much going on between work and her four kids that I don’t want her to have an aneurysm, of course,” Kardashian Barker said in a confessional.
Other than studying for the bar, Kardashian said she’s busy getting ready for the Met Gala and to take the stand at her 2025 Paris Robbery trial.
“I can’t believe that she has to relive it,” Kardashian Barker said in a confessional.
Due to everything her sister has been dealing with, Kardashian Barker asked Kardashian why she feels the need to study for the bar right now.

“I wonder why she feels the need to go to law school and do this. It’s fine if it’s your passion and whatever, but isn’t there a time to do it later when your kids are more grown and they don’t need you as much?” Kardashian Barker asked.
However, Kardashian said that she can’t pause her studies because she’s close to finishing her law program, which she completed in May, and is also “addicted to studying.”

“I just look at things differently. I love that my kids see me go to school,” she said in a confessional. “When I drop them off at school, they see me go to school. I enjoy that. It’s like I love educating myself. I just wouldn’t feel like myself if I wasn’t learning and trying new things. That’s just what I like to do. We’re all totally different.”

Though Kardashian Barker said that she has a different viewpoint on life, the Skims founder said that she’s going to try her best not to stress, especially after she learned that someone had “put a hit out” on her life.
After completing her law program in May, Kardashian revealed she failed the California bar exam in a Nov. 9 TikTok video.
The reality TV star also opened up about how stressful her life can be in a preview clip for Season 7 of “The Kardashians” that aired during Episode 1.
In the clip, Kardashian could be seen having a phone conversation with her sister Khloé Kardashian and her mom, Kris Jenner.
“This week has been the hardest week of my life,” she said.
“I’m happy it’s over,” she added in a confessional.

title: Miss Jamaica Gabrielle Henry Recovering After Falling Off Stage During Pageant
summary: A Miss Universe contestant is recovering after suffering a major fall during the pageant.
story: A Miss Universe contestant is recovering after suffering a major fall during the pageant.
In a shocking moment during the preliminary evening gown round on Nov. 19, Miss Jamaica Gabrielle Henry took a massive fall off the stage.

In video shared by Meekii Modez on Instagram, Henry is seen walking across the stage in a stunning orange gown with high heels. After posing at the front, she continues to walk towards the left of the stage when she takes the tumble.
People are seen standing up in shock to make sure she is OK.
Additional video online shows a group of people coming to her aid and removing her on a stretcher.

Hours later, the Miss Universe Jamaica Organization released a statement offering an update on Henry. The organization confirmed that she “experienced a fall from the main stage during the evening gown round” ahead of the Miss Universe finals this weekend in Thailand.

“She was rushed to the Paolo Rangsit Hospital, where medical professionals are attending to her care and have advised that she is not suffering from any life-threatening injuries,” the statement posted on Instagram reads. “However, they continue to conduct tests to ensure her full recovery.”

The organization asked for people to “stay upbeat, lift her in prayer, and send positive thoughts as she receives the necessary medical care.” It also thanked people for the outpouring of love and support.
Prior to the accident, Henry had participated in the national costume and swimsuit portion of the pageant.
Miss Universe Organization President Raúl Rocha also shared an update on his Instagram, writing that he left the hospital where Henry is being treated.
“I was there with her family and her, and thankfully, there are no broken bones and she is under good care,” he wrote in part.
The 74th Miss Universe competition kicked off with the sashing ceremony on Nov. 5.

The pageant got off to a rocky start after Miss Mexico Fatima Bosch spoke out following an argument with pageant executive Nawat Itsaragrisil, who criticized and singled her out at an official event. The Thai businessman and national director of Miss Universe Thailand would go on to apologize to Bosch after Rocha also condemned his behavior.

title: Heinz Is Selling a New Condiment Inspired by the Thanksgiving Leftovers Sandwich From ‘Friends’
summary: Heinz's new Leftover Gravy sauce is inspired by the Ross' Moist Maker sandwich from "Friends." Here's how to get your hands on the squeezable condiment.
story: Everyone knows leftovers are the very best part of Thanksgiving. Now, Heinz wants to make it easier than ever to douse your day-after turkey in gravy.
With just one week left before the big day, the brand is launching a new condiment called Leftover Gravy in a convenient squeeze bottle.
Wondering what inspired the new product and how to get your hands on a bottle? Here’s everything we know.
Yes, It’s Inspired by a Popular ‘Friends’ Episode
Heinz threw it back to a ‘90s sitcom while drawing inspiration for its latest innovation.

Fans of “Friends” will likely remember the 1998 episode titled “The One with Ross’s Sandwich.” In the episode, Monica makes a “Moist Maker” sandwich filled with leftovers for Ross. A layer of bread soaked in gravy is one of the sandwich’s defining details.
On Nov. 18, Heinz shared a photo of its squeezable gravy on Instagram and captioned the post, “The One Where HEINZ Makes a Gravy for Leftovers.”
Social media users had a lot of feelings about the idea, with many expressing their excitement.
“Umm YuM this better be real!” one commented. Another wrote, “Need this 😍.”
One Instagram user weighed in, writing, “The ultimate sandwich gravy you say, sign me up.”
But not everyone was sold on the idea. One social media user even called the product “a crime against humanity.”
Another questioned if it was as good as it sounded, writing, “Ok you all think it’s a good idea but has anyone tasted/tried??”
The Squeezable Gravy Is Already Sold Out

On Nov. 18, Heinz Leftover Gravy made its debut on Walmart.com as part of a limited-edition Heinz Leftover Gravy kit that came with one squeezable bottle of gravy, a jar of Heinz Homestyle Turkey Gravy and a recipe for the “Ultimate Thanksgiving Leftovers Sandwich.”
The kits, which cost $1.88, sold out quickly, but Heinz has plans to add additional kits for sale on Walmart.com throughout the rest of the week.

title: 'Squid Game: The Challenge' Winner Reveals What She Plans to Do With Her $4.56M Prize
summary: After several weeks of cutthroat competition, "Squid Game: The Challenge" just wrapped its sophomore season and declared a winner
story: After several weeks of cutthroat competition, "Squid Game: The Challenge" just wrapped its sophomore season and declared a winner.

The reality series, which is inspired by the scripted show “Squid Game,” tasks contestants with surviving the same challenges they witnessed in the original show. (Of course, players only pretend to die in the reality competition.)
At the beginning of Season 2, 456 players embarked on a journey to win the $4.56 million prize. Along the way, they had to outlast each other in a series of high-stakes children’s games.

The Season 2 finale began on a high note for the five finalists — Dajah, Perla, Steven, Trinity and Vanessa — as they enjoyed a well-deserved gourmet dinner while dressed in their finale tuxedos. But the mood quickly shifted as a new game began.

In a move no one saw coming, Trinity graciously sacrificed his own game to allow the other finalists to continue on in the competition. Then things got real. The remaining four contestants had to compete in a game of "Red Light, Green Light" with Young-hee, an animatronic doll from the show.
Contestants were tasked with a race to the finish line, but they could only move after Young-hee said "green light." Vanessa was eliminated first, followed by Steven.
One of two people left, Dajah suffered an untimely injury while running. The motion triggered a response from Young-hee, and Dajah was eliminated, leaving Perla the last contestant standing.

As she reflected on the gravity of the moment, Perla narrated her inner thoughts in a voiceover and said, “I am the last woman standing. It’s just me and the finish line. I had faith, I had strength and I had the luck. I am about to win ‘Squid Game.’”
Once Perla crossed the finish line, she dropped to her knees in joy and said, "Thank you, God."
In a confessional interview, Perla expressed her relief after winning.

"Now I can finally take care of my family. I can breathe now. Money is not gonna be a worry and that is just something I've never been used to. I just feel like the luckiest girl in the world right now to be honest," she said.
After, Perla could be seen visiting her family and celebrating her big win.

"I always felt powerful, but now I'm like, 'I am powerful.' I am never doubting myself any longer. Like if I say I am gonna do something, I am gonna do it no matter what," she said in a voiceover. "I am a force to be reckoned with."
Perla Reflects on the 'Hardest Part' of 'Squid Game'
Perla looked back on her time on “Squid Game: The Challenge” in an interview with TODAY.com.

“I think the hardest part for me was obviously in (the) slides and ladders (game), not letting the full Bronx of me come out, and start cooking people verbally. I did a little bit of it, but not too much,” she said, referencing one challenge that turned tense for the contestants.
During the game, another contestant tried to make Perla feel guilty by reminding her she was playing for her son at home. The emotional manipulation didn't sit well with Perla.

"As an empath, it was really hard because obviously I do care that you have a dream and a reason to be here, but I think it’s very unfair (to act that way). I have a lot of friends in the show that had kids and never threw it in anyone’s face. So it was really tough," she said.
Perla, who entered the competition with her brother, said she "was already losing my mind" after her sibling was eliminated.
"I was just like, this is the last thing I could hear," she said.
Going into the competition, Perla wasn't quite prepared for how intense the experience would be.

"I knew that production plays games with you, like mental games in the dorms and setting these like little traps. But I think our season, it doubled and then we were constantly being like, 'Is this person doing that because of da da da da? Does he have a coin?'" she said. "So the mental games that they play with you in the dorms, it was actually even crazier to experience it than watching it from Season 1."
What Will Perla Do With the Money?
After witnessing Perla win the competition, the question on every viewer’s mind is: What’s she going to spend her earnings on?

“I will definitely buy my mom a house. That has been her dream since we all moved to America and it’s really hard to get a house in America. So that would be No. 1," she said. "And then, you know, get a boob job."

title: 5 Books to Read After 'Cursed Daughters' According to Author Oyinkan Braithwaite
summary: Author Oyinkan Braithwaite recommends six books to read after Cursed Daughters. Read on for more romances and books about marriage.
story: “Cursed Daughters” by Oyinkan Braithwaite is the story of sisters, mothers, daughters — and a family curse.
Jenna Bush Hager said the book, the November 2025 Read with Jenna pick, “delighted her.”
“This is a book about family, sisterhood and what it means to fall in love,” Jenna said, with “a few epic love stories at the center.”

Braithwaite offered a few books to read after finishing "Cursed Daughters." Like her followup to "My Sister the Serial Killer," these options are macabre and intoxicating, with strong women and memorable settings.
Rebecca by Daphne du Maurier

Daphne du Maurier’s 1938 classic opens in sunny Monaco, where a young woman meets, and falls for, a dashing older man. After a whirlwind romance, he whisks her away to his coastal England home — where she learns the legacy of his ex-wife still looms so large she is practically a ghost. How will our nameless narrator deal with the presence of Rebecca? Du Maurier’s novel goes to unexpected and unforgettable places.
We Have Always Lived in the Castle by Shirley Jackson

Like in “Cursed Daughters,” “We Have Always Lived in the Castle” is about a quirky family in a large, empty house. Shirley Jackson's novel is famous for its charged sister relationship and for a narrator who is charming, but far from reliable.
The Secret Lives of Baba Segi's Wives: A Novel by William Morrow

“Cursed Daughters” looks at many years in one Nigerian family’s romantic history, including accounts of multiple wives. Poet Lola Shoneyin’s fiction debut is also a family saga set in Nigeria is a novel about modern-day polygamy, following a man, his four wives and their seven children.
Selfish Girls by Abigail Bergstrom

Ines goes home to Wales after many years away, bringing her fiancé in tow. Greeting her are her mother and two sisters, with baggage and dreams and secrets of their own. Can they get past their defenses and find connection?
The Original Daughter by Jemimah Wei
Genevieve Yang grows up thinking she was an only child. Then, a girl shows up, bringing with her family secrets. The novel tracks Genevieve and Arin’s diverging paths in Singapore over many years.

title: Watch Jeff Goldblum Serenade the TODAY Studio with His Lovely Piano Skills
summary: Jeff Goldblum sang and played the piano when he and "Wicked: For Good" co-star Jonathan Bailey appeared on TODAY.
story: Jeff Goldblum is a wizard on the piano.
The veteran actor showed off his ability to tickle the ivories when he appeared Nov. 19 alongside “Wicked: For Good” co-star Jonathan Bailey on TODAY.

Savannah Guthrie had been talking up Bailey, who was named People’s Sexiest Man Alive for 2025 earlier this month, for his ability to play the clarinet, when she shifted the focus to Goldblum by asking if he could play them out to break as their segment ended.
“We got to end on a high note, literally,” she said. “Because Jeff Goldblum — accomplished jazz pianist.”
“Yes, extraordinaire,“ Bailey concurred.

Goldblum, who reprises his role in “Wicked: For Good” as The Wonderful Wizard of Oz from 2024’s Oscar-winning smash “Wicked,” was happy to oblige with the request, walking over to a keyboard where he sat down and put on am impromptu performance while he plugged the highly anticipated movie.
“We’ll buy a ticket to go see ‘Wicked’ on Friday,” he began singing as he played. “But first we’ll visit you, Savannah, today.”
Savannah and Bailey, who returns in “Wicked: For Good” as Fiyero, then walked over to Goldblum as he continued.
“The city’s clamor will never spoil, with dreams of two boys and a girl / We’ll turn Manhattan into an isle of joy,” he continued before finishing, as Savannah and Bailey cheered.
“We love you,” she said, while Bailey gave him a hug.

Goldblum’s piano prowess is par for the course in Bailey’s eyes. He gushed about his co-star, even though they don’t share much screen time in “Wicked: For Good,” with Goldblum noting they’re only in one scene together.
“They say never meet your heroes. But do if it’s Jeff Goldblum,” Bailey said. “It’s true.”
There’s sure to be plenty of more singing that you can see and hear for yourself when the highly anticipated “Wicked: For Good” opens in theaters Nov. 21.

title: Zac Efron Supports Brother Dylan on 'DWTS' Prince Night
summary: Zac Efron made an appearance on "Dancing With the Stars" to support his brother, Dylan Efron, for the semifinals, Prince Night.
story: Zac Efron finally made his “Dancing With the Stars” appearance during Prince Night, just in time to support his younger brother Dylan Efron as they headed into the finale.
During the semifinals on Nov. 18, “The Traitors” winner took to the ballroom floor with partner Daniella Karagach.

For his first dance of the night, Dylan Efron danced a tango to “I Would Die 4 U,” which earned him and Karagach a 27 out of 30. As the judges were giving him feedback, the cameras flashed to the audience and Zac Efron was spotted with their little sister, Olivia, sitting on his lap.
Zac Efron was all smiles as Olivia clapped for her older brother.
This was the first time that the “Iron Claw” actor made his way to the “DWTS” ballroom and showed his support for his brother in person.
During the episode, on his Instagram story, Zac Efron also encouraged his followers to vote for his brother by sharing the number fans could text to get him to the finale.
People on social media were overjoyed to see Zac Efron in the audience and expressed their excitement online.
Dylan Efron had told Extra back in October that his brother hadn’t come to a show because he was “doing his thing,” adding that Zac Efron’s been “supporting me every day.”
Dylan Efron had also given a nod to his big brother when he danced with Olivia to Zac Efron's song with Zendaya, “Rewrite the Stars,” from “The Greatest Showman” for Dedication Night.
Dylan Efron returned to the dance floor to dance a cha cha to “Kiss.” This time, he got a 28 out of 30 for a total score of 55 out of 60.
Luckily, Dylan Efron and Karagach were among the five couples to make it to the finale, which will take place on Nov. 25.

title: 'Selling the OC' Cast Season 4: Who's New, Who Left and Who's Returning?
summary: Who is new to the cast of Selling the OC Season 4? Who left in Season 3 and who is returning? Here's a list of the cast of Selling the OC and their bios.
story: Netflix’s “Selling the OC” has returned for Season 4 with major cast change-ups.
Six cast members left after Season 3: Alex Rose, Kayla Cardona, Alexandra Jarvis, Ali Harper, Sean Palmieri and Lauren Shortt.
Who’s returning to "Selling the OC" after the seismic change-up? And who are the new agents joining the cast? Here’s what to know.
Who’s New to 'Selling the OC' Season 4?

Ashtyn Zerboni is a 29-year-old agent who hails from Fresno, California. Four months pregnant at the time of filming, Ashtyn seems to be working non-stop, commuting between the Oppenheim Group’s San Diego and the Orange County offices.
“I originally thought I would want to be a stay-at-home mom, being pregnant, but i just can’t stop working,” she says in the first episode’s confessional.
Her daughter has since been born.

Fiona Belle is a 23-year-old Orange County native. A recent graduate of the University of California San Diego, she started her career at the Oppenheim Group office in San Diego, according to her Linkedin page.
“I started my real estate career when I was 21 and I don’t think my age limits me in this industry,” she says in the season premiere.
While Fiona doesn’t feel limited by her age, her fellow agents might not agree.

“Fiona is a little bit of a newbie” Ashtyn says in a confessional. “I think that in a few years, maybe, Fiona could be a great real estate agent. When she has a couple more million-dollar listings under her belt, but we’ll see how she does.”
Kaylee Ricciardi has been in the real estate industry for 13 years, entering the scene through the Coachella and Stagecoach festivals’ luxury rental market, according to her O Group bio.
The 35-year old agent says that “this niche has allowed me to create a network from celebrities to the biggest CEOs in the world.”
Who’s Returning?
While Tyler has stayed within the Selling the OC family, he’s no longer a member of the Oppenheim Group after leaving almost two years ago.
Now he’s working in the family business, which is also real estate. He tells the camera it’s the “best choice he’s ever made.”
Brandi Marshall is all about her business, but is ready to dish out some good advice to the new women on the team.

When Ashtyn brings up a rumor that she heard about Tyler, Brandi is quick to warn her. “Just watch the way you move,” she tells her. “That same way you found out that information, somebody could have something to say about you.”
“A lot has changed within the last year and a half,” Alex says in the season premiere. “We lost a lot of soldiers.”
Even with certain cast members gone, Alex is certain that the dramatic tone of the office will remain.
“I’d like to say we got rid of some people and everything’s great and jolly and chipper, but it’s not, because we get rid of one and bring in another.”
Plus Alex now has to come face-to-face with Tyler, who in her words, “Shut me out, broke my heart.”
Polly is back in the real estate market. She says she’s “wheeling, dealing,” and her “phone is blowing up the whole time with buyers.”

In addition to her career forward attitude, she’s also trying to meet the one — and the audience gets to join her on a date with a man named Luke. “Summer House” fans will recognize him as Luke Gulbranson from Seasons 4 and 5.
Gio has been as the “self-proclaimed top dog of the OC” and he’s returning for another season of that same energy.
“This year my goal is to change the game,” he says in his opening confessional. “And make sure the OC office becomes the highest grossing branch within the O Group brokerage.”
He starts the season off strong with his competitive energy, flexing his “biggest listing to date.”

Austin the family man is back where we left him, but with one new member to his growing army at home. Austin and his wife, Lisa Victoria, welcomed son Aeson in 2024, joining older twin sisters Hazel and Lila.
A brand new baby in the house is just one of the new pieces of the puzzle for Austin this season. He says he hasn’t seen Tyler in 18 months.
“He cut me, and all of us out of his life after he left The O Group,” he says.

title: Who Was Selena Quintanilla's Husband? What to Know About Chris Pérez
summary: Chris Pérez, the widower of the late Mexican American pop star Selena, shares rare comments about the couple's life together in the new Netflix docuseries “Selena y Los Dinos."The Texas-born singer, whose full name was Selena Quintanilla Pérez, found fame singing in both Spanish and English and was known as the Queen of Tejano Music.
story: Chris Pérez, the widower of the late Mexican American pop star Selena, shares rare comments about the couple's life together in the new Netflix docuseries “Selena y Los Dinos."

The Texas-born singer, whose full name was Selena Quintanilla Pérez, found fame singing in both Spanish and English and was known as the Queen of Tejano Music. In March 1995, Selena's life was cut tragically short at age 23 when Yolanda Saldívar, the former president of her fan club, shot and killed her.

The docuseries, which premiered Nov. 17, explores Selena’s love story with Pérez, who became a guitarist in her band. Though her father and manager, Abraham Quintanilla, initially objected to the young lovers’ romance, they secretly eloped in April 1992 and were together until Selena’s death.
Read on to learn more about Pérez and the role he continues to play in his late wife’s life.
Who Is Chris Pérez?

Pérez played lead guitar in Selena’s band, Selena y Los Dinos. The band also included Selena’s older brother A.B. Quintanilla on bass and sister Suzette Quintanilla on drums, and was managed by the siblings’ father Abraham Quintanilla.
Pérez later went on to form the Chris Pérez Band, winning a Grammy in 2000 for the album “Resurrection.”
How Did Selena and Chris Pérez Meet?
Pérez successfully auditioned for a spot in Selena y Los Dinos in 1990, the Los Angeles Times reported.

When Pérez, who was already a fan of the band, met Selena in person, he thought she was “beautiful and talented,” he told  Entertainment Tonight in 2018. “I’m a shy person by nature, and there was something about her that was just able to pull me out,” he said.

The pair’s relationship turned romantic after the band flew to Acapulco, Mexico. While there, Pérez felt a new closeness and chemistry with the “Bidi Bidi Bom Bom” singer, he explained during a 2021 interview on the “Anything for Selena” podcast.

When their plane began experiencing turbulence, Selena took Pérez’s hand, he recalled. “(I thought), maybe she was just being (a friend), she knows I’m freaking out from the turbulence ... At the same time, I knew there were sparks,” Pérez said.
Pérez also recalled worrying about giving into his feelings. “Dude, she was like massaging my hand and there I am like, duh, I didn’t know what to think. Add to that, we worked together,” he said.
When Did They Get Married?
The couple initially kept their love affair a secret from Selena’s father but they found it difficult to hide their joy.

“We were in Laredo when we had our conversation about how we both felt the same way about each other. Selena had the biggest smile on her face when we were walking back to the bus afterward,” Pérez told Texas Monthly in 2010. “I’m smiling right now just thinking about it. I wanted to tell her, ‘Hey, quit smiling! You’re going to give it away.’ ”
After Abraham Quintanilla found out about the couple’s romance, he kicked Pérez out of the band despite Selena’s protests.

Selena and Pérez eloped on April 2, 1992 when Selena was 21, Texas Monthly reported. Abraham Quintanilla told the publication that after Pérez married his daughter, he “accepted him as part of the family” and allowed him to rejoin Selena’s band. This was also confirmed in “Selena y Los Dinos.”

Following the couple's marriage, Selena began mentioning in public her love for Pérez. When she accepted the award for female entertainer of the year at the 1993 Tejano Music Awards, she acknowledged their love in her speech.
“I’d like to thank my husband. I love you,” she said.
How Was Chris Pérez’s Relationship With Selena’s Family After Her Death?

Years after Selena's death, tensions between Pérez and his father-in-law resurfaced in December 2010 when Abraham Quintanilla sued Pérez and the media production company Endemol Shine Latino to halt production of a planned Selena bioseries, NBC News reported at the time.
The series was to be based on Pérez’s 2012 memoir about his late wife, “To Selena with Love.”
Abraham Quintanilla’s suit stated that his late daughter’s estate, which he controlled, owns “all proprietary rights in the name, voice, signature, photograph, and likeness of Selena.”

It further stated, “Defendant Pérez expressly agreed that he would not exploit any of the Entertainment Properties in any manner or medium, including, without limitation, by way of a book, television series, movie, or any other motion picture medium.”
Five years later, in September 2021, the pair filed a joint motion to dismiss the lawsuit, Pérez revealed.

“Good news! I have amicably resolved my legal dispute with the Quintanilla family,” he tweeted at the time. “Now that these issues are behind us, going forward, my hope, and the hope of the Quintanilla family, is for us to work together to continue to honor and celebrate the legacy of Selena.”
Pérez, who appears alongside Selena’s family members in the “Selena y Los Dinos” docuseries, has remained close to his sister-in-law and former bandmate Suzette Quintanilla.
The two posed together under a mural of Selena last month in Los Angeles.

“Like everything, family has disagreements about certain things, but we’re past that,” Suzette Quintanilla told E! News this month during a joint interview with Pérez. “I will always consider Chris family, and I know that he feels the same way about me, and that’s it.”
She added, “At the end of the day, we’re family. We have each other’s back.”
What Has Chris Pérez Said Recently About Selena?
Pérez told People in November 2025 that 30 years after his late wife's tragic death, she is always on his mind.
“I think about Selena every day,” he said. “When I’m making a decision, I can hear her in my head, like, ‘I don’t know — are you sure you wanna do that?’
The guitarist said the love he shared with Selena is still precious to him.

“As time has gone on, you romanticize it even more,” he said. “The love story is a big part of her legacy. My most prized possessions are her love letters.” He reads one of her letters in “Selena y Los Dinos.”
He added in his People interview that the pain of Selena’s death still haunts him.

“I’m Chris before all of that happened, and Chris after,” he explained. “She’s a part of both sides. I’ve lived with her presence in thoughts and feelings and music. That’s become my new normal. But I can’t watch the end of the documentary about her death. It’s just difficult.”
What Does Chris Pérez Say About Selena in ‘Selena y Los Dinos’?
In the Netflix documentary, Pérez says he was “starstruck” when he met Selena and her band.

“The honest truth was I was just more taken aback by the power of the band and the music and the sound,” he said, before touching on his early relationship with Selena. “At first, we didn’t hang out too much. Selena was always either off with Suzette or her mom.”
He credited the long tour bus trips to them becoming friends.
“Anytime we were next to each other, it would just be me and her talking about music and movies and things like that,” he said, admiring how it was “cool seeing her being a normal person.”
Pérez also commented on Selena’s “vulnerable side,” as well as spoke about their trip to Mexico as a band when he started to have stronger feelings for her.
He recalled their first kiss, as well as when their bandmate Ricky Vela walked in on them. Pérez also said he was “genuinely in fear” of Selena’s father and what he would say.
“But what we had going with each other, I didn’t want to jeopardize that at all,” he said.
Pérez also reads a letter Selena wrote to him before they got married and recalls the moment her dad got upset with him when he found out about their relationship.
Selena’s widow also touches on the day he found out she died.
“I do miss her a lot. But today, I’m very proud of what she represents and the small part that I might play in that story,” he said.

title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
summary: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
story: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”
The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials.

Trump said in an interview on Brian Kilmeade's radio show Friday that the deadline is "an appropriate time" and said that he has no plans to lift U.S. sanctions on Russia while the administration waits for a response to the peace proposal. The president also suggested that Ukraine would "lose in a short period of time."
"They're losing land," Trump said about Ukraine.

At a gathering of reporters at the White House on Friday, Trump said that the plan is "a way of getting peace" that needs to be approved by Zelenskyy. "He’ll have to like it, and if he doesn’t like it, then, you know, they should just keep fighting, I guess," Trump said.
He added, "Well, at some point he’s going to have to accept something. You know he hasn’t accepted. You remember right in the Oval Office, not so long ago, I said you don’t have the cards."
The U.S. communicated the Thursday deadline to the Ukrainian government, though the officials stressed this was more of a goal than a firm deadline.
Negotiations to end the conflict are expected to be quite complex and will take more than a week to hash out, these officials acknowledged.

On reports that the U.S. threatened to halt intelligence sharing and weapons supplies for Ukraine if the deal is rejected, a senior administration official said: “It was strongly implied to the Ukrainians that the United States expects them to agree to a peace deal. Any changes will be decided upon by the president himself.”
“This is one of the most difficult moments in our history,” Zelenskyy said in a somber 10-minute video addressed to the Ukrainian people.

“Currently, the pressure on Ukraine is one of the hardest,” he said. “Ukraine may now face a very difficult choice, either losing its dignity or the risk of losing a key partner, either the difficult 28 points, or a very difficult winter” Zelenskyy added, urging the nation to stay united during what he said would be "a very difficult, eventful" week.
Russian President Vladimir Putin struck a more upbeat note, saying the plan could “form the basis of a final peace settlement,” though he said it had not been discussed “substantively” with Russia.
Putin said that if Ukraine rejects the proposal, Russia would seek to achieve its objectives "through military means, through armed struggle."
The stark warnings came as Ukraine and its allies raced to respond to the proposal that would grant Russia key demands at a moment of weakness for Kyiv.
Zelenskyy later shared in a post on X that he spoke with Vice President JD Vance and Army Secretary Dan Driscoll for almost an hour Friday about the plan.

"We agreed to work together with the U.S. and Europe at the level of national security advisors to make the path to peace truly doable," Zelenskyy said. "Ukraine has always respected and continues to respect U.S. President Donald Trump’s desire to put an end to the bloodshed, and we view every realistic proposal positively."
The Kremlin maintained that it had not seen details of the plan, but urged Ukraine to make a "responsible decision" in light of mounting battlefield pressure.

Zelenskyy held an urgent call with the leaders of Britain, Germany and France, after which he said he valued Trump's efforts and would keep working with American officials to ensure Kyiv's "principled stances are taken into account."
The sudden emergence of the plan has fueled unease across the continent, which fears a deal imposing major concessions on Ukraine could further embolden Russia.

A senior U.S. official told NBC News that the plan was drawn up immediately following discussions with Rustem Umerov, the secretary of Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council. He “agreed to the majority of the plan, after making several modifications, and presented it to President Zelenskyy,” the official said.
Umerov denied this Friday.

"During my visit to the United States, my role was technical — organizing meetings and preparing the dialogue. I provided no assessments or, even more so, approvals of any points. This is not within my authority and does not correspond to the procedure," he said in a post on X.
White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said that any deal must provide full security guarantees and deterrence for Ukraine, Europe and Russia.

“This plan was crafted to reflect the realities of the situation, after five years of a devastating war, to find the best win-win scenario, where both parties gain more than they must give,” she said.

title: American who spied for Israel says he met Ambassador Mike Huckabee to 'thank' him for his support
summary: Convicted Israeli spy Jonathan J. Pollard downplayed the controversy around his private meeting with U.S.
story: Convicted Israeli spy Jonathan J. Pollard downplayed the controversy around his private meeting with U.S. Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee, telling NBC News the visit was “personal” and “wasn’t done surreptitiously.”
The “main point” of the meeting at the U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem in July, Pollard said, was to “thank” the ambassador for “his efforts on my behalf during my incarceration.”

Pollard, a former American intelligence analyst, spent 30 years in prison on espionage charges after being found to have passed critical security documents to Israeli intelligence in the 1980s. Israel made Pollard a citizen during his lengthy prison term, and he moved there in 2020, five years after his release on probation.
During Pollard’s detention, Huckabee was among several pro-Israeli politicians who advocated for his release, arguing that the sentence was too severe for someone who had been spying for an ally.

Pollard described his meeting as more of a social call and insisted the two didn’t discuss politics or Gaza. But the meeting comes amid a growing list of episodes in which the ambassador, a fierce champion of Israel, has appeared to deviate from official White House policy as the Trump administration deepens its involvement in Middle East diplomacy and peacekeeping.

The New York Times first revealed the meeting Thursday. In a statement, a spokesperson for the U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem said the article “is filled with inaccuracies” and said Huckabee “has meetings each day with numerous people and as a matter of general policy we don’t comment as to the content of conversations.”
The embassy offered no further information and declined to offer a comment from the ambassador himself.
“The White House was not aware of that meeting but the president stands by our ambassador,” press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Thursday.
Pollard said the meeting was “a simple story” that “got far more complicated than it deserved.”

He told NBC News that he had arranged the visit simply by phoning up the ambassador’s office. “He had nothing to hide and I had nothing to hide," Pollard said, adding that it was an “intensely personal visit to thank him” for his work while he was incarcerated.
But there were questions across the political spectrum for Huckabee over his decision to meet the notorious spy, whose long imprisonment drove a wedge between the U.S. and Israel.

Rep. Joaquin Castro, D-Texas, who sits on the House Intelligence Committee, said in a post on X that Huckabee should not have met with “a convicted traitor,” while former Fox News host Tucker Carlson said Huckabee’s conduct was “shocking behavior from a United States ambassador.”
But this isn’t the first time that Huckabee, a two-time presidential candidate, former governor of Arkansas and self-described Christian Zionist, has ruffled feathers on policy.

The ambassador told Israeli media in early September that the U.S. would not stop Israel from annexing the occupied West Bank. The White House and several senior administration officials have since made it clear that the U.S. would oppose such a move.

Earlier this year, he told the Bloomberg news agency that the U.S. was no longer pursuing the goal of Palestinian statehood, which has long stood as a central feature of American diplomacy in the Middle East. A U.S.-backed plan for Gaza approved by the United Nations earlier this month restated support for a future “credible pathway to Palestinian self-determination and statehood.”

Huckabee has regularly used the religiously loaded term “Judea and Samaria” to refer to the West Bank, the mostly Palestinian enclave that Israel has occupied since 1967. In 2008, he said that “there is no such thing as a Palestinian” and that Palestinian nationhood is just a “political tool to try and force land away from Israel.”
In an interview with NBC News on Sunday before news of the Pollard meeting broke, he downplayed talk of a rift with the White House and struck a decidedly more obedient tone.

“I don’t get to make the policy. I simply carry it out as an ambassador,” Huckabee said. “I’ve had some very strong opinions on it, but my job here is not to be the chemist making the medicine. My job is simply to be the pharmacist and dispense it.”

title: Taps run dry as water crisis forces Iran to consider evacuating its capital
summary: Iran is facing its worst water crisis in decades, with authorities warning they may even have to evacuate Tehran amid a drought, climate change and mismanagement.
story: TEHRAN, Iran — A drastic new message adorns the walls of the Iranian capital, usually reserved for war heroes and weapons.
“There is a water shortage!” reads the government poster's slogan, inside a water container that is nearly empty. “It’s fall and there is still no rain.”
That’s not news to Erfan Ensani, 39, who returned home from a long day working in the textile section of the city’s central bazaar last week to find his taps running dry.

Iran is facing its worst water crisis in decades. With no end in sight and authorities warning they may even have to evacuate the capital of 10 million people, residents like Ensani are scrambling to respond.

“We didn’t have water for three days. The pressure was so low that nothing came out,” Ensani, who, like many residents, works two jobs to make ends meet, told NBC News in a recent interview in Tehran.
“The water company says we should buy pumps to solve the problem and also get a storage tank to keep some water. But that’s expensive, especially now when the economy is bad,” Ensani said.

title: U.S. retiree freed after years jailed in Saudi Arabia for critical tweets
summary: A U.S. retiree held in Saudi Arabia over critical tweets has been freed months ahead of schedule, his son said, a day after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman appeared hand in hand with President Donald Trump at the White House."Our family is overjoyed that, after four long years, our father, Saad Almadi, is finally on his way home," his family said in a statement his son Ibrahim posted Wednesday on X. Riyadh authorities jailed and then banned Saad Almadi, 75, from leaving the country two years ag
story: A U.S. retiree held in Saudi Arabia over critical tweets has been freed months ahead of schedule, his son said, a day after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman appeared hand in hand with President Donald Trump at the White House.
"Our family is overjoyed that, after four long years, our father, Saad Almadi, is finally on his way home," his family said in a statement his son Ibrahim posted Wednesday on X.
Riyadh authorities jailed and then banned Saad Almadi, 75, from leaving the country two years ago, downgrading his previous 19-year sentence, which was handed down in 2021.
Ibrahim told CNN that his father, originally from Boca Raton, Florida, was arriving in Philadelphia on Thursday, crediting the Trump administration for his release.
"This day would not have been possible without President Donald Trump and the tireless efforts of his administration," the family said in a statement, also thanking Trump official Sebastian Gorka.
"No American Left Behind. That is President @realDonaldTrump’s promise from Day One. @WhiteHouse,” Gorka said, reposting the family statement.
The State Department did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Trump has touted his dealmaking abilities, having freed several Americans imprisoned in other countries, including six Americans from Venezuela and others from Russia, Afghanistan and Belarus.

Almadi's release came as Trump bolstered U.S. ties with Saudi Arabia, the once deeply conservative, oil-dependent theocracy that the 40-year-old crown prince is trying to transform into a modern and more moderate global power.
Trump was attending a Saudi investment conference in Washington as the news that Almadi was free emerged.
Almadi, a retired project manager who immigrated to the United States in the 1970s, had written over a dozen tweets critical of the Riyadh government.
He was arrested in November 2021 during a visit to Saudi Arabia for a medical procedure and sentenced to prison on terrorism-related charges.
The kingdom freed him after more than a year in prison, dropped his charges to "cyber crimes" and prevented him from leaving the country until next March.
One of the tweets Saudi authorities confronted Almadi over discussed the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, his family has said.

His early release comes after Trump defended the crown prince over the murder of Khashoggi, the Washington Post columnist, disavowing the findings by his own intelligence agencies and telling reporters in the Oval Office that the crown prince “knew nothing about it.”
The CIA concluded that he had ordered the killing.
The crown prince has cracked down on internal criticism, with human rights defenders inside and outside the country warning about unfair trials, arbitrary arrests and executions.
While Almadi may have been released, hundreds of people remain jailed or detained in the kingdom, including journalists, activists, scholars and aid workers, human rights groups say.

Crown Prince Mohammed has worked hard to repair his country's image on the global stage, pressing his modernization drive while wielding the kingdom’s power as the world’s largest oil producer and a growing diplomatic player.

On Tuesday, he made his first visit to the White House since the murder and received an elaborate welcome that included a military flyover and an honor guard on horseback — as well as Trump's rhetorical defense.
Despite the crown prince's success in partially modernizing Saudi society and the economy, the country of 33 million people remains a monarchy where expressing dissent can be dangerous.
Asked about Khashoggi's murder Tuesday, the crown prince promised that “we are doing our best that this doesn’t happen again.”
“It’s been painful for us in Saudi Arabia,” he said.

title: 'Hero' teachers fended off grizzly that attacked students on Canada walking trail, injuring 11, officials said
summary: Teachers who were well prepared and well equipped may have ended a grizzly bear attack on their group of Canadian schoolchildren in British Columbia before it became deadly, authorities said Friday
story: Teachers who were well prepared and well equipped may have ended a grizzly bear attack on their group of Canadian schoolchildren in British Columbia before it became deadly, authorities said Friday.
Two people were critically injured, two were seriously injured, and seven others were treated at the scene Thursday afternoon, BC Emergency Health Services said in a statement.

At a news conference Friday, Tamara Davidson, minister of environment and parks in the Canadian province, said that three children and one adult were seriously injured and remained hospitalized. Their relatives did not want to release the patients' latest conditions, she said.

"I want to recognize the teachers who took great risk to protect their students," she said. "Their actions deserve our greatest respect and gratitude. They were well prepared, and they are the true heroes."

Kevin Van Damme of the BC Conservation Officer Service said the teachers used bear spray and small noisemakers called bear bangers to repel the animal in the area of Bella Coola, the name of a small town and its underlying valley between the Coast Mountains and Queen Charlotte Sound.

"During a school outing, the group had stopped along a trail near the community where a single grizzly bear emerged from the forest and attacked," he said. "Teachers put themselves in harm's way to protect the children. They definitely avoided worse injuries."

Authorities were collecting evidence from the attack site to help identify and capture the bear, Van Damme said. In the meantime, residents and visitors in the area, known for outdoor activities, were told to stay indoors.

"I really need to stress how dangerous this situation is with this bear at large," Van Damme said, adding later during the news conference: "I have not seen an attack like this — with a large group of people."
He added that an incident involving more than a dozen people is "extremely rare."
The Nuxalk Nation of Indigenous people in the region asked everyone in the area to "avoid all trails."

The board and administration of Acwsalcta School, an independent institution run by the Nuxalk Nation in Bella Coola, said in a statement that school would remain closed Monday and that counseling would be available.
Parent Veronica Schooner told The Associated Press that, among the many who tried to halt the attack, one teacher “got the whole brunt of it” and was transported to a hospital.
Schooner said her 10-year-old son Alvarez was in the class of fourth and fifth graders attacked by the bear and was close enough that “he even felt its fur.”
“He said that bear ran so close to him, but it was going after somebody else,” Schooner said.
She added that some children were hit with the bear spray.

The British Columbia Assembly of First Nations, an umbrella organization for the 204 First Nations of Indigenous people in the province, said the attack should inspire reconsideration of measures to prevent such incidents.

"This event raises important questions about safety protocols, community preparedness and the respect for First Nations’ knowledge in managing wildlife," the organization said in a statement that also expressed solidarity with the Nuxalk Nation.

The B.C. Wildlife Federation, a nonprofit that works toward environmental preservation, said on Friday that a 2017 province ban on hunting grizzlies correlates to a rise in such attacks because the bears, plentiful in Bella Coola, have been freer to learn behavior dangerous to humans.
Since the prohibition started, the federation said in a statement  Friday, the number of bear reports to the British Columbia Conservation Officer Service has doubled.
“With no hunting pressure, grizzlies and humans will increasingly occupy the same spaces with inevitable consequences,” BC Wildlife Federation Executive Director Jesse Zeman said.
While the federation expressed hope the incident would lead to reconsideration of the hunting ban, Davidson, the province's parks minister, said it was too soon.
"This is an ongoing live situation where the bear is still at large and the community doesn't feel safe," she said. "No considerations just yet."
At the same time, Davidson said, her ministry hopes the families of those attacked experience "healing and comfort in the coming days."

title: Territorial concessions by Ukraine, a capped army and security guarantees: What's in Trump's draft plan
summary: Ripples of alarm were coursing from Kyiv through  Europe, as details emerged of President Donald Trump’s 28-point peace plan for Russia and Ukraine.
story: One man’s peace plan could, in another continent’s eyes, amount to a dangerous capitulation.
Ripples of alarm and anger were coursing from Kyiv through  Europe on Friday, as details emerged of President Donald Trump’s 28-point peace plan for Russia and Ukraine.
“This is one of the most difficult moments in our history,” Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in a 10-minute video Friday. “Currently, the pressure on Ukraine is one of the hardest.”

The 28 points, published by Axios and confirmed to NBC News as accurate by a source familiar with the matter who has seen different drafts of the plan, suggest that Russia would be granted even more Ukrainian territory than it already holds, and that Ukraine would have to limit the size of its army and agree to never join NATO.
The White House insists that the plan is fair, and that it was drafted in consultation with both sides.
Rustem Umerov, the secretary of Ukraine’s National Security and Defense Council, downplayed any involvement in preparing the plan during a recent visit to the U.S.
